place.name: FLORDON
place.gazetteerText: FLORDON, a parish in Henstead district, Norfolk; on the Eastern Union railway, near the river Yare, 7½ miles S by W of Norwich. It has a station on the railway, and a post office under Long Stratton. Acres, 929. Real property, £1, 737. Pop., 163. Houses, 36. The property is divided among a few. Flordon Hall is the seat of Sir W. R. Kemp, Bart. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, not reported. Patron, Sir W. R. Kemp, Bart. The church is tolerable; and there are charities £7. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
